titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Samuel Myers Papers 1808-1812
titlestmt.subtitle: Myers, Samuel Papers UA 5.098

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid created by Danny Vivas, SCRC Staff, 2009

frontmatter.titlepage:
Inventory of the Samuel Myers Papers, 1808-1812 A Collection in the
Special Collections Research Center UA 5.098
Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary 2012 &contact;
Processed By
Special Collections Staff.

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: This collection is composed of the correspondence, a certificate, Myers' commencement remarks, and a list of books of College of William and Mary student Samuel Myers. The letters includes Myers' career plans, events in Williamsburg including a near-duel Myers was involved in, and other matters.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Before reproducing or quoting from any materials, in whole or in part, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Research Center, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Samuel Myers Papers, Special Collections Research Center, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: This collection was formerly part of the University Archives Faculty-Alumni File Collection (UA 10).

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection was accessioned by Amy Schindler, University Archivist, and described by Danny Vivas, SCRC Staff, in April 2009.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Samuel Myers (1790-1829) lawyer in Norfolk, Pensacola, Florida, and son of Moses Myers. Further information about this individual or organization may be available in the Special Collections Research Center Wiki: http://scrc.swem.wm.edu/wiki/index.php/Samuel Myers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection is composed of the correspondence, a certificate, Myers' commencement remarks, and a list of books of College of William and Mary student Samuel Myers. The letters includes Myers' career plans, events in Williamsburg including a near-duel Myers was involved in, and other matters.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Samuel Myers Papers(Mss. 95 M99); Myers Family Papers (Mss. 98 M99 Myers II); see the SCRC Collections Database for other collections related to members of the Myers family: http://scrc.swem.wm.edu/

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.

controlaccess.head: Topical Term:
controlaccess.subject: College of William and Mary--Faculty and Staff
College of William and Mary--History--19th century.
College of William and Mary--Students.
Dueling--Virginia.
